snippet: The National Academy of Sciences said a controversial policy of moving animals to holding facilities as a means of population control was ineffective.
abstract: National Academy of Sciences report catalogs range of problems with way Bureau of Land Management manages thousands of wild horses and burros that roam American West; says counting methods are inconsistent and most likely inaccurate; says policy of moving animals to holding facilities as means of population control is ineffective; animal rights advocates say program is cruel.
lead_paragraph: The National Academy of Sciences said a controversial policy of moving animals to holding facilities as a means of population control was ineffective.

headline.seo: Federal Stewardship of Wild Horses Criticized in Report
headline.main: Report Criticizes U.S. Stewardship of Wild Horses
headline.print_headline: Report Criticizes Federal Stewardship of Wild Horses
